comments:
It's ok profiling java applications but, trying to profile Tomcat 5.5 server, I always get next error:


!ENTRY org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui 2006-07-05 23:46:18.343
!MESSAGE Processed: 28556 bytes, bytes/second: 28556, events processed: 283, events/second: 283, elapsed time: 1 seconds
!SESSION 2006-07-05 23:50:56.187 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=M20060629-1905
java.version=1.5.0_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=es_ES
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-07-05 23:52:51.031
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Launching".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.tomcat.core.internal.TomcatLaunchConfigurationDelegate.launch(TomcatLaunchConfigurationDelegate.java:69)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:639)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:565)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:754)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:944)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)



ACServer is running, Tomcat is able to start for normal and debugging correctly.

Thanks!
I believe Profile on Server is covered under the Profiling Perspective.  Please correct if necessary.
What TPTP and WTP versions are you using ?

Note that i can profile tomcat server with copping generated tomcat profile configuration to simple java application profiling configuration:
setting tomcat's bootstrap as main class, start as parameter, and setting same VM parameters as TPTPT generated profile tomcat configuration.

So the problem could be at tomcat configuration/starting point...

Are you trying to start profiling from the Profile Launch configuration wizard ?

In other words, run profiling using Profile..> Tomcat > New config ?

If this is the case, can you try to start the server in profiling mode by using the Profile button available on the Server view main toolbar ( open the Server view , select the server instance, right-click and select Profile )

I cannot reproduce the problem with the following drivers:

Eclipse 3.2 :
    eclipse-SDK-3.2-win32.zip
EMF/XSD/GEF/JEM: 
    emf-sdo-xsd-SDK-2.2.0.zip
    GEF-runtime-3.2.zip
    JEM-SDK-1.2.zip
WTP:
    wtp-R-1.5.0-200606281455.zip
TPTP:
    tptp.runtime-TPTP-4.2.0.zip
TPTP Agent Controller:
    agntctrl.win_ia32-TPTP-4.2.0.zip

I profiled a simple web application on Tomcat 5.5.15 with IBM JDK 1.5

java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build pwi32devifx-20060124)
IBM J9 VM (build 2.3, J2RE 1.5.0 IBM J9 2.3 Windows 2000 x86-32 j9vmwi3223ifx-20
060124 (JIT enabled)

As in comment #5, did you profile with Profile Launch Configuration? or using profile action in server view?

Please also make sure "Agent Controller"/bin folder is included in system path to help JVM locate piAgent.dll file.

Marking bug as invalid, please provide more information to proceed.

1. org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui
2. org.eclipse.tptp.platform.profile.server.core
